ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie project stats
ygData.msgSnippet: I know - NOW - note the COULD below - you used to be able to do this - no longer. About the same time that other stuff started happening with invis. IMHO - not
ygData.messageBody:
I know - NOW - note the COULD below - you used to be able to do this - no
longer.

About the same time that other stuff started happening with invis.

IMHO - not something that was broken - they should have left it be.

Whether it's an intentional fix - or an unpleasant side effect of something
else - who knows - Verant certainly isn't terribly forthcoming with info on
what they change or why.



At 10:13 AM 6/29/00 -0700, you wrote:
>Um. My enchanter cast Invisibility then Invis vs Undead on a groupmate.
>The Invis Vs Undead icon overwrote the Invisibility icon.
>
>Yes, if you are invisible and go through a bard song when it pulses,
>the icon remains but you are no longer invisible. My friend,
>Windsong's, a bard who has gotten killed by this. (The now
>no-longer invisible person was aggro'd on by monsters that
>then came back and killed Windsong, because she transferred to their
>aggro-list somehow.
>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: silky@... [mailto:silky@...]
>>Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 10:07 AM
>>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie project stats
>>
>>
>>
>>If you had someone else casting on ya - yeah you could.
>>
>>Been playing a druid lately - invis has a MAJOR problem now - if you are
>>invis - and someone casts on you - anything - the icon doesn't go away, but
>>mobs can see you - songs pulsing probably work the same way.
>>
>>Why do I consider this a bug? Well, thinking you are invis - and not is a
>>problem - it also opens the door to being pk'd via monster.
>>
>>Also - harmony does it too - and harmony has a LARGE area of effect. I've
>>accidentally uninvis'd folks in unrest by harmony on a totally different
>>floor - while they were above or below invis.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>>I do not know if you ever could have both these cast on you at once.
>>>You can't anymore. My enchanter, who has both spells, has tried to do
>>>so on her groupmates. One overwrites the other (whichever is cast last
>>>overwrites the first)
>>
>>
>>
